column5: Congrats on your first Bows. Your hooked now. Glad to see young anglers getting out. Then mom looking over the table at her son, Eating her sons catch. Lots of rewards I can see from a great sport. Should be more kids like yourself. Merry Christmas and may you catch more in the new year
Nice looking fish, Urban, and congratulations.  Looks like the perfect size for the table.  Glad your Mom got to enjoy 'er too!  Cheers!
hey brick, i didnt have any roe, and snagged my last jig on a log, lol, all day ive been using pinkies, no need to change, that what i found out...  thnx guys for comments!

congrats dawg! pinkies are wicked baits, last season i think i caught just as many fish using pink worms as i did using roe bags. dont listen to the guys that are ripping on you for keeping your second rainbow ever, as long as you were in your legal limits, you ate it, and your mom enjoyed it, its all good hombre! hopefully we'll see you on the river
way to go ...and i hope that nice little silver bullet tastes real nice,oh ya dont forget the garlic & lemon...mmmmmmmmm
Tasty results.  Nice one dood.
Nice lookin fish....im a steelie virgin . Urban angler next time you go for some steelies send me a pm, I'd love to tag along...
It turned out very delicious, we had a few long stripes and just breaded it with seasonings, dill weed, pepper, salt. Had it with mashed patatoes and sauce. Reallly tastttyyy! good stuff...
PLease practive  Catch, Fillet, release in pan
Awesome fish and the perfect for doing just what you did.
i went out today to trib unknown in the morning and managed this guy, my second steelie of my young career...
Looks like that was a dead one     Got into 10 this weekend, all released.

yeah that one is going on the pan, im usually a catch and release fisherman, but mom wanted a nice fish fry today...   yeah that one is going on the pan, im usually a catch and release fisherman, but mom wanted a nice fish fry today...
Way to go!   Feels good when you start catching what you are after!  blyght
way to go young man!
That's a nice little guy!  Perfect eating size.  What did you get him on?
awesome looking steelie there my friend.... great t see the younger generation getting into chromers... cliff...
Congrats on 'bow #2...  Mike
Nice dude, still haven't got my first one but it's coming I can feel it, WTG
Better still if they released them....
Nice fish, W2G, No problem keeping one or two for the pan.    jordan
Good stuff!  Always nice to get onto new fish...never fished for Steelies myself.  Looks like a nice one.  Maureen
give the guy a break, he's caught 2... kept one for some dinner

Theres not a thing wrong with keeping the odd one providing it's not wasted !!!  catch and release is important as well  but those who enjoy the odd fish can do so without harming the fish population..........  cliff...

the 3 inch pinky, it works wonders lol.   like i said im almost always catch and release, cept this time, lol, and yeah only my second one caught, ive seen guys carry out limits sooo...   thanks guys for comments and nice words!
Nice fish dude  get out the garlic butter!!!! perfect meal
Ahh love the background
, i dont have photoshop skills, and didnt have cam at river...

leave the guy alone.. so he kept a fish for the table.. he is well within his legal rights to do so... and personally they are great eating!!!Mmmmmm... dude whens supper? I'll bring the beer.  Gerritt.
, already swiming again   , next time for sure ! lol
Nice going bud...  You don't have to justify yourself to anyone...Enjoy.  Craig
Yup! nice one for Trout Almondine!!!  ...and that was catch and release, released into a skillet of hot oil!

Exellent on you and congrats. Im curious if you changed up to pinkies cuz roe/flies werent working??? If I caught a smallish chrome such as yours once a week... it too would be heading to the pan!!!!!!! They've all been so big lately.....I can taste it already....hope you enjoyed it.
Nice job UA and congrats.  Thanks for the report.

Great job!!  Hope he was as tasty as he looks in your pics!  You are well within your right to keep fish...as long as it's within regs...so I hope he made a great meal for your mom.  Hope to see more reports from you!
